node.statement: Justify sum interchange by fubini-tonelli: We need to interchange sum_{k>=0} and sum_{j=0}^{n} in (1/e) sum_{k>=0} (sum_{j=0}^{n} S(n,j) k^{underline{j}})/k!. All terms S(n,j) k^{underline{j}}/k! are non-negative (S(n,j) >= 0, k^{underline{j}} >= 0 for k >= j, k! > 0). By fubini-tonelli for non-negative series, interchange is valid: = sum_{j=0}^{n} S(n,j) (1/e) sum_{k>=0} k^{underline{j}}/k!. By falling-factorial-sum, each inner sum equals e, so = sum_{j=0}^{n} S(n,j) * 1 = B_n.
